team.title: Paid Marketing Exec
team.name: Joycelyn Longdon
team.bioHtml: A versatile and entrepreneurial Astrophysics student combining technical, numerical and analytical skills with demonstrated creative vision and content creation

jobs.title: Graduate Sales Executive
jobs.description:
The Role

MVF keeps growing, and we need you to help us scale even faster! If you’re driven, commercially aware and have that entrepreneurial flair, we’ll equip you with the tools you need to drive growth at an award winning Tech company.

As a Graduate Sales Executive, you’ll be researching and building a pipeline of multinational clients. From there, you’ll develop new business via the phone, networking and face to face. This role isn’t just new business though, as the account manager you’ll also be helping our existing clients expand into new territories and markets.

Working closely with our Technology and Digital Marketing teams, you’ll launch new verticals and uncover new revenue streams for MVF. You’ll become a trusted partner working consultatively with our clients to enable their growth.

You’ll be joining our Sales Academy from the start; a fast-track programme designed for ambitious individuals who want an accelerated career path in global sales. The scheme combines one-to-one coaching from our leading sales directors with inspiring classroom based training, covering every aspect of sales, from how to identify a high value target to how to close a deal and maximise your existing client relationships.


‘People joining this team will make a significant impact on MVF’s growth and enjoy an uncapped commission structure for delivering exceptional results’


Our Team

The Business Development team work with fast-growing businesses in both the B2B and B2C sectors.

We operate in over 120 countries and help over 1,000 clients expand into new markets and territories every month. Because our service has such transparent ROI, we work closely with our partners to build them a profitable and scalable channel of new customers. Our Business Development Managers develop a strong client base of market leading companies and continue to consult closely with them to help improve close rates and support their teams to make sure they get the most from our leads.




Our Ideal MVFer

Some level of consultative sales experience is great, though not essential
Driven
Commercially Intelligent
Articulate
Entrepreneurial
 

Our Story

MVF is a global customer generation business supplying some of the world’s leading brands with high volumes of new customers in over 120 countries. In 2013, MVF topped the Sunday Times Tech Track as the fastest growing tech company in the UK, and this year was also named the business with the 50th fastest growing profits in the UK. This is the third year that MVF has also been ranked in the top ten places to work in the UK by the Sunday Times Best Companies list.

We are on a mission to accelerate our clients’ growth by building the world’s most effective marketing platform through a passion for data, relentless innovation and the development of world-class teams. We want you to help get us there!

Company culture is very important to us, and that is why we were voted in the top 2 (!) places to work in the Sunday Times Best Companies List 2018, and why we are constantly looking for ways to make MVF an even better place to work. People join us to change the industry, work with world-class talent, develop their careers and become part of our remarkable culture.


If you’re looking for the opportunity to be at the heart of a growing, award-winning Tech business, having a massive impact from day one, then please apply now!

jobs.title: Paid Media Executive
jobs.description:
Our Story

MVF is one of the UK’s leading marketing technology companies. In 2013, MVF topped the Sunday Times Tech Track and we’re currently ranked as the top company to work for in London on the Sunday Times Top 100 Companies to Work For list. We now employ around 400 staff in the UK and USA, and conduct marketing activities in more than 120 countries.

 

Our Team

The Emerging Paid Media team grows the latest and most exciting digital channels into MVF’s media mix, currently Twitter and Pinterest. Our aim is to be an early adopter, testing old and new ideas to identify how to appeal to the audiences of these uncharted digital channels to generate high quality leads for our clients. We’ve profitably grown spend by 210% in the past three months and are a market leader in using Pinterest and Twitter for performance marketing in the UK.

 

The Role

You will be joining the Emerging Paid Media team. You will design, create and manage a number of high-performance ad campaigns on Twitter, Pinterest and potential future emerging channels that come out of MVF’s New Channels Team.

The team’s activities are a vital part of making sure MVF stays ahead of the curve. In your role as an early adopter, you’ll need an entrepreneurial mindset to make these emerging channels thrive with a creative license to try almost anything. You’ll have the persistence and high output required to make a large number of campaigns work in uncharted digital marketing channels. You’ll be able to work with our other marketing teams to adapt their winning creatives for your products to the audiences of your channels, briefing in creative designers on fresh ideas or using your editing chops to create your pins and tweets.

It is a dynamic role with a unique blend of creativity and analysis. You’re responsible for finding the right people, for the right products and showing them the right message - all while ensuring your activities are as profitable as possible!

 

Responsibilities:

Manage, launch and expand Pinterest and Twitter accounts picked out of over 40 different countries and 30 different products within three weeks
As required, manage campaigns in potential future emerging channels that come out of MVF’s New Channels Team, e.g. Snapchat
Create Promoted Tweets and Pins using photo-editing tools, adjust existing creative content used in other marketing channels, and leverage creative designer resources within and outside the company
Test different audience targeting approaches (interest, keywords, remarketing, etc.)
Own metrics of existing campaigns (conversion rates, CTR, etc.)
Optimise campaigns using Google Analytics and internal reporting tools
Liaise with ad networks (Twitter & Pinterest) to test emerging innovations and BETAs
 

Our Ideal MVFer:

Creative or visual background, e.g. freelance web designer or graphic designer during uni
Excellent analytical and numerical ability, e.g. an A at Maths A-level or proficiency with Excel data manipulation
Photo editing skills, e.g. Photoshop, Illustrator
Highly persistent with a desire to make things work
A detail-oriented individual with a combination of creative and analytical skills

jobs.title: Paid Search Executive
jobs.description:
Our Story

MVF is one of the UK’s leading marketing technology companies. In 2013, MVF topped the Sunday Times Tech Track and we’re currently ranked as the top company to work for in London on the Sunday Times Top 100 Companies to Work For list. We now employ around 400 staff in the UK/USA and conduct marketing activities in more than 120 countries.

We are on a mission to accelerate our clients’ growth by building the world’s most efficient marketing platform through a passion for data, relentless innovation and the development of world-class teams.

 

Our Team

The Biddable Marketing Team advertises across paid social and paid search channels, primarily Facebook and Google. We aim to create precisely targeted campaigns to engage positively with our customers. As a member of our team, you’ll need strong analytical skills and a keen eye for picking through data. We have a strong culture of creativity, too; you’ll be able to try out almost any campaign idea you can think of. With nearly half a billion impressions a month, you’ve probably seen our ads somewhere around the internet.

 

The Role

As a Paid Search Executive, you will be responsible for managing advertising campaigns on Google predominantly. After a month of intensive training, you’ll be thrown in at the deep end with your own campaigns to manage. You’ll need to pinpoint relevant audiences and think about how they might search for, or respond to, a particular product. You’ll use these deductions to create dynamic and engaging adverts, and conduct post-campaign analysis to refine their performance.  You will then test all the data and inferences you have made to see what strategies bring the best responses. You’ll gain real-time insights into behavioural patterns across a wide range of markets and languages - one of the most satisfying parts of the role is seeing the impact your decisions have on your campaign performance right before your eyes.

Overall, it is a dynamic role with a unique blend of creativity and analysis. You’re responsible for finding the right people, for the right products and showing them the right message - all while ensuring your activities are as profitable as possible!

“Working in the Biddable team is about using as many data points as you can to catch the right person, at the right time, with the right message.”

 

Responsibilities:

Complete our Biddable Academy, including detailed instruction on the platforms we use, training in Excel and data analysis, basics of creative design, and how to apply what you’ve learned within the MVF business model.
Build successful marketing campaigns from scratch, including engaging ad copy or creative, relevant audience targeting and appropriate keyword analysis.
Run activity on accounts within the first four weeks across a range of sectors, deploying appropriate management techniques based on your thorough and detailed analysis of performance metrics.
Maximise the performance of your campaigns in line with key performance indicators for the business, including delivering high-quality leads and optimising return on investment.
Establish a healthy relationship with other members of the biddable team, keeping them up to date with the performance of your campaigns, any issues you’ve encountered and any opportunities you’ve found.
Immerse yourself in the digital industry, keep up to date with relevant trends and look out for new techniques. It’s important to stay ahead of your competitors to give your campaigns the edge!
 

Our Ideal MVFer:

Evidence of strong analytical and numerical ability
A highly motivated individual with a strong work ethic and a desire to succeed
A passion for digital marketing
A detail-oriented individual with a combination of creative and analytical skills
A proactive and independent approach to working life

jobs.title: Social Media Analyst
jobs.description:
Our Story

MVF was started in 2009 by 5 friends with the sole aim of transforming how businesses find new customers. We believe in growth - not just growth for our clients, but growth for MVF and the amazing people that make us who we are. To help accelerate this growth, we’re looking for the very best to jump on board.

Our Team

The Biddable Marketing Team advertises across paid social and paid search channels, primarily Facebook and Google. We aim to create precisely targeted campaigns to engage positively with our customers. As a member of our team, you’ll need strong analytical skills and a keen eye for picking through data. We have a strong culture of creativity, too; you’ll be able to try out almost any campaign idea you can think of. With nearly half a billion impressions a month, you’ve probably seen our ads somewhere around the internet.

The Role

As a Media Analyst, you will be responsible for managing advertising campaigns on Facebook predominantly. After a month of intensive training, you’ll be thrown in at the deep end with your own campaigns to manage. You’ll need to pinpoint relevant audiences and think about how they might search for, or respond to, a particular product. You’ll use these deductions to create dynamic and engaging adverts, and conduct post-campaign analysis to refine their performance.  You will then test all the data and inferences you have made to see what strategies bring the best responses. You’ll gain real-time insights into behavioural patterns across a wide range of markets and languages - one of the most satisfying parts of the role is seeing the impact your decisions have on your campaign performance right before your eyes.

Overall, it is a dynamic role with a unique blend of creativity and analysis. You’re responsible for finding the right people, for the right products and showing them the right message - all while ensuring your activities are as profitable as possible!

“Working in the Biddable team is about using as many data points as you can to catch the right person, at the right time, with the right message.”

 Responsibilities:

Complete our Biddable Academy, including detailed instruction on the platforms we use, training in Excel and data analysis, basics of creative design, and how to apply what you’ve learned within the MVF business model.
Build successful marketing campaigns from scratch, including engaging ad copy or creative, relevant audience targeting and appropriate keyword analysis.
Run activity on accounts within the first four weeks across a range of sectors, deploying appropriate management techniques based on your thorough and detailed analysis of performance metrics.
Maximise the performance of your campaigns in line with key performance indicators for the business, including delivering high-quality leads and optimising return on investment.
Establish a healthy relationship with other members of the biddable team, keeping them up to date with the performance of your campaigns, any issues you’ve encountered and any opportunities you’ve found.
Immerse yourself in the digital industry, keep up to date with relevant trends and look out for new techniques. It’s important to stay ahead of your competitors to give your campaigns the edge!
 Our Ideal MVFer:

Evidence of strong analytical and numerical ability
A highly motivated individual with a strong work ethic and a desire to succeed
A passion for digital marketing
A detail-oriented individual with a combination of creative and analytical skills
A proactive and independent approach to working life

jobs.title: Content Marketing Executive
jobs.description:
Our Story

MVF is one of the UK’s leading marketing technology companies. In 2013, MVF topped the Sunday Times Tech Track and we’re currently ranked as the top company to work for in London on the Sunday Times Top 100 Companies to Work For list. We now employ around 400 staff in the UK and USA, and conduct marketing activities in more than 120 countries.

 

Our Team

Content Discovery Networks are the newest and fastest growing channel at MVF. Our ads are seen by over 2 billion people a month, and our CDN team are the market leaders in the UK. The key to this  success is our focus on creativity - if you think you can craft a punchy headline and you have a natural flair for writing great copy, CDN is the right team for you.

 

The Role

You will design, create and manage a number of high performance ad campaigns. We use CDNs such as Taboola and Outbrain to write engaging content and closely manage campaign metrics, with the ultimate aim of  generating customers for clients across the globe. The role offers a unique blend of the creative and the analytical. We take our own photographs, write our own copy, design our own web pages - and keep a close eye on the bottom line. While you’ll need a good brain for maths, there’s the creative license to try almost anything: everyone here is an entrepreneur.

‘In the CDN team, 100,000 people across the world will read your headline every minute.’

 

Responsibilities:

Creating online adverts with new headlines and images
Creating article-style pages for use as content advertising
Testing page variations - using HTML and photoshop to design new webpages
Managing the metrics of  existing campaigns (conversion rates, CTR etc.)
Reporting on Gross Profit performance
Optimising campaigns using Google Analytics
Liaising with ad networks (Taboola, Outbrain, Yahoo!) to test new innovations
 

Our Ideal MVFer:

Copywriting or journalistic background (e.g. writing for a university newspaper)
Excellent mathematical ability
Language skills
Ability to code (HTML, CSS, Javascript)
Photo editing skills

In your role as an early adopter, you’ll need an entrepreneurial mindset to make these emerging channels thrive with a creative license to try almost anything. You’ll have the persistence and high output required to make a large number of campaigns work in uncharted digital marketing channels. You’ll be able to work with our other marketing teams to adapt their winning creatives for your products to the audiences of your channels, briefing in creative designers on fresh ideas or using your editing chops to create your pins and tweets.

It is a dynamic role with a unique blend of creativity and analysis. You’re responsible for finding the right people, for the right products and showing them the right message - all while ensuring your activities are as profitable as possible!

Responsibilities:

Manage, launch and expand Pinterest and Twitter accounts picked out of over 40 different countries and 30 different products within three weeks
As required, manage campaigns in potential future emerging channels that come out of MVF’s New Channels Team, e.g. Snapchat
Create Promoted Tweets and Pins using photo-editing tools, adjust existing creative content used in other marketing channels, and leverage creative designer resources within and outside the company
Test different audience targeting approaches (interest, keywords, remarketing, etc.)
Own metrics of existing campaigns (conversion rates, CTR, etc.)
Optimise campaigns using Google Analytics and internal reporting tools
Liaise with ad networks (Twitter & Pinterest) to test emerging innovations and BETAs

Our Ideal MVFer:

Creative or visual background, e.g. freelance web designer or graphic designer during uni
Excellent analytical and numerical ability, e.g. an A at Maths A-level or proficiency with Excel data manipulation
Photo editing skills, e.g. Photoshop, Illustrator
Highly persistent with a desire to make things work
A detail-oriented individual with a combination of creative and analytical skills

jobs.title: Digital Strategist
jobs.description:
What you'll be doing:

As an Digital Strategist, you will be responsible for creating and executing the SEO campaigns strategy that delivers the brand goals. You will work closely with the brand Editor and Deputy Editor to present and validate SEO campaigns that aim at acquiring links from identified link targets and build the brand authority. You will coordinate and deliver SEO campaigns from end to end working with stakeholders across the business.

You will either be part of expertmarket.co.uk; our award winning B2B brands or you will be part of everydayhearing.com ; our newly acquisitioned brand 
Award-winning Campaigns on the Gender Pay Gap on expertmarket.co.uk
1.5 million views in June 2019 alone

About you:

You will be an SEO expert, having worked in a similar role previously in either an agency or in-house.
You will have the skills and experience to create campaign strategy and will have examples of when you have delivered tangible results in the past.  
You will get great exposure across the business along with interacting with key stakeholders across the business.

About the team:

The Publishing team is the heart of MVF who are responsible for all of MVF’s websites , based in Camden Town and are tasked with making sure they are all operating at a world class standard in terms of quality and performance. The department consists of:
Vertical brand hubs – Set the strategy for our brands and are responsible for ensuring they achieve commercial targets
The Content team - responsible for the production of all of our content and assuring it is of the highest quality. on all of our sites and ensuring they meet their organic traffic and revenue targets
The SEO team - responsible for setting on-site and off-site SEO strategy for our sites, for implementing technical SEO best practice and securing high value links and coverage for our websites.
The Digital Strategist unsurprisingly sits within the SEO team!

What we offer you:

Competitive salary and ample opportunity for progression and development.
We take learning seriously here at MVF - you’ll receive a yearly £,1000 training budget, unlimited book allowance and have access to our company library. You perform best when you’re at your best! To aid this we have morning pilates classes, at lunchtime we have PT, boxing, frisbee, gymnastics, basketball and badminton classes, and after-work we have an abundance of yoga.
Start your day off right with our plethora of breakfast choices including 9 different types of milk, chia seeds, fresh fruit, coconut yoghurt, sourdough bread and lots of cereal!
Keep topped up throughout the day with fresh fruit and nuts.
We’re a sociable bunch and have a social committee that arranges quarterly socials - think adult ball pits and 90s themed parties.
 
MVF was started in 2009 by 5 friends with the sole aim of transforming how businesses find new customers (in a nutshell, customer generation). We believe in growth - not just growth for our clients, but growth for MVF and the amazing people that make us who we are. To help accelerate this growth, we’re looking for the very best to jump on board. 
https://www.mvfglobal.com/

jobs.title: Email Marketing Executive
jobs.description:
Our Story

MVF was started in 2009 by 5 friends with the sole aim of transforming how businesses find new customers. We believe in growth - not just growth for our clients, but growth for MVF and the amazing people that make us who we are. To help accelerate this growth, we’re looking for the very best to jump on board.

Our Team

The CRM team are a 16 strong team of exceptionally talented marketers. Our daily mantra is to consistently break new ground in Email Marketing and Customer Acquisition. With over 80 million emails being sent a month, we have an enormous audience to connect with.

The Role

You will be responsible for creating engaging, innovative, and relevant content, designing templates and managing the send schedules, for a broad range of high-impact campaigns across multiple markets and languages. You will need to analyse campaign performances, identify opportunities and make data driven decisions to maximise the performance of your personal market. Think of it as your own mini business.

In CRM, we maximise:

The lifetime value of a subscriber to MVF

The value a subscriber gets out of us

But most importantly…

The potential of our team and the individuals within it - i.e. YOU

Responsibilities:

Delivery, optimisation and scheduling of campaigns to maximise your gross profit contribution to MVF’s targets
Producing world class content that you can be proud of
Creating and delivering fantastic user experience for our subscribers
Exciting testing and innovation to constantly improve campaign performance
Analysis and insight to drive market and team decisions
Significant collaboration with the entire CRM team and other teams in MVF
Making commercial decisions to optimise against client orders and budgets
Personal contribution towards the team roadmap and milestones (i.e. the big projects!)
Our Ideal MVFer:

Logical problem solver
Commercially savvy and able to prioritise high value tasks effectively
Is passionate about delivering world class content and UX journey for the user
Seeks to learn every day and helps to improve the team and the company
Understands the importance of data driven decisions

jobs.title: Marketing Strategy Analyst
jobs.description:
MVF was started in 2009 by 5 friends with the sole aim of transforming how businesses find new customers (in a nutshell, customer generation). We believe in growth - not just growth for our clients, but growth for MVF and the amazing people that make us who we are. To help accelerate this growth, we’re looking for the very best to jump on board. 

What will you be doing? 

You’ll be given an area of expertise to ‘own’ (this may be a geographical location or product category) and will be responsible for setting and executing the strategy, whilst finding new ways to grow. We believe in setting up our MVFers for success and facilitating autonomy - this means we’ll equip you with all the skills needed not only to be phenomenal at your job but help you get to that next level; whether that’s an upward or lateral move. Our training consists of a Marketing Operations academy, structured mentor programme and a week-long company onboarding programme. 

We’re looking to hire the next future leaders of MVF which means no micromanagement and no being told what to do. You’ll use data to lead the way, suggest improvements and together we’ll achieve our target of being valued at $1 billion. 

That means you will 

- You’ll be developing digital marketing plans for the wider business based on client orders.
- You’ll build quarterly strategies that promote the growth of your geographical area and report against this.
- You’ll be working on exciting long-term Roadmap projects that will accelerate the Marketing Operations team to the next level.
- You’ll be using your top-notch data analysis skills to identify trends and spot opportunities - you’ll be sharing this with the wider team and implementing an action plan.
- You’ll be the key point of contact for all marketing operations for the area you look after.
- You will have a very good understanding of all online marketing channels used in the company.
- You will be able to understand the demographic that works best for the client based on their services and work with marketing to attract them.
- Create reports and presentations on how your strategic marketing plan performs against objectives and reflect on performance so far.

You’ll love this role if 
- You love using numbers to identify trends, spot opportunities and build an action plan off the back of this.
- You’re happy to work collaboratively across a number of different teams and love achieving results together.
- You have a commercial flair - you understand the importance of business and can see how your role fits into our wider company goals.
- You’re a problem solver, relish challenges and enjoy seeing projects through to see the results.
- You love being given responsibility and relish working autonomously

What we will offer you: 
- Competitive salary and ample opportunity for progression and development.
We take learning seriously here at MVF - you’ll receive a yearly £,1000 training budget, unlimited book allowance and have access to our company library.
- You perform best when you’re at your best! To aid this we have morning pilates classes, at lunchtime we have PT, boxing, frisbee, gymnastics, basketball and badminton classes, and after-work we have an abundance of yoga.
- Start your day off right with our plethora of breakfast choices including 9 different types of milk, chia seeds, fresh fruit, coconut yoghurt, sourdough bread and lots of cereal!
- Keep topped up throughout the day with fresh fruit and nuts.
- We’re a sociable bunch and have a social committee that arranges quarterly socials - think adult ball pits and 90s themed parties. 

Learn what it’s like to work in the Marketing Operations team here: 
HTTPS://WWW.MVFGLOBAL.COM/NEWS/JULIETTE-DAY-IN-THE-LIFE

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer PHP Node.js
jobs.description:
We are:

A global customer generation business, supplying some of the world’s leading global brands with high volumes of new customers.  We’re on a mission to accelerate our clients’ growth through a passion for data, relentless innovation and the development of world-class teams - and we want you to join us!

We believe that people are our greatest strength, and are lucky enough to have a world-class team of 450+ MVFers building our remarkable culture and driving growth for our clients, primarily in the UK and US - and we’ll soon be launching our third office, this time in the APAC region.

We believe in working smarter, not harder.  People join us to develop their careers, work with top talent - and transform the industry.  We’ve grown rapidly and consistently over the last ten years, topping the Sunday Times Tech Track in 2013.  We weren’t happy with 6th place in the Sunday Times Best Companies 2017 - so we made 2nd place in the Sunday Times Best Companies 2018!  

Our Technology team delivers our industry-leading platforms across every aspect of the business - content publishing, customer acquisition, marketing automation, global-scale CRM, and analytics across petabytes of data.  We work with every other department to add massive value for all our customers - and we’re constantly looking for talented people to join us.

 

You are:

An enthusiastic, self-motivated, technically-astute senior engineer, eager to continue developing your technical skillset whilst helping to shape the future and direction of our industry-leading platform in one of our high-performing, autonomous teams.

You’re passionate about building what’s right for the user; you’re willing to take ownership of features - and contribute to making them superb.  You’re keen to use your deep technical ability to develop the architecture and design of our platforms - and (most importantly) you’re confident questioning and constructively critiquing the status-quo.

You’re an accomplished PHP developer, with in-depth commercial engineering experience - and you have experience of transitioning systems from PHP to Node.js.  Node.js is one of our strategic technical frameworks and will be the platform on which we build a significant amount of our new functionality.

 

Your role:

You’ll bring your technical aptitude and engineering experience to bear on complex customer-facing problems, solving them alongside a team of talented colleagues to rapidly deliver the right solution.  You’ll have the opportunity to work across any and all of our platforms - we positively encourage our people to move teams and try new things - and you’ll work with the team to define and implement the future architecture for our products.

As a senior engineer, you can expect to be fully involved in the team from day one, including code reviews and daily standups, and you’ll be involved in discussions around delivery, architecture and software design of current and upcoming technical work. You’ll be working alongside other senior engineers to deliver highly-performant code, solve in-depth technical challenges and mentor more junior team members.

 

Your skills and experience:

Solid track record of commercial development in PHP, mySQL & Node.js
Lean/Agile environment exposure,  with continual improvement focus
Demonstrable experience of TDD/BDD - and the benefits (or otherwise!)
Commercial awareness of business impact alongside engineering excellence
Clear ability to prioritise tasks and  drive them through to completion
Bonus points for…

Exposure to architecture and/or AWS-based development
 

What we offer:

Individual training budget to spend on your professional development 
1 day per week work-from-home policy
10% time to work on personal projects you feel might benefit MVF most
Unlimited book allowance 
Your choice of hardware 
Huge range of sports and culture clubs 
Free healthy breakfast!

If you have a true passion for Technology and are driven to learn, develop and become world class through a data centred approach to Development, then please apply.
